newsitem.title: USA: IES Utils plans brief shutdown at Iowa nuke.
newsitem.headline: IES Utils plans brief shutdown at Iowa nuke.

text.p: IES Utilities plans to shut its 538 megawatt (MW) Duane Arnold nuclear power plant over the weekend for repairs, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) reported Friday.
The unit, in Palo, Iowa, is currently operating at about 90 percent of its rated capacity and decreasing power.
IES plans to "place (the) unit in hot shutdown to repair well water leak in containment cooling system" the NRC said, adding the restart is currently scheduled for March 17.
IES Utilities is a unit of IES Industries Inc.
